author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Virudhunagar district administration has made a wide range of specialised arrangements for the differently-abled voters to ensure their smooth movement in the polling stations enabling them to vote on May 16 polling for the Assembly elections.

The Collector, V. Rajaraman, said that the differently-abled persons need not wait in the regular queue of voters at any polling station. They can jump the queue and cast their votes.

Besides, all the polling stations in the district have been provided with ramps for their benefit. “We have planned to provide wheel chairs for all required people at the polling stations on the day of polling,” he said.

At a special camp organised for the visually challenged persons held at Sattur, the importance of voting and the means of enrolment, incorporating changes in the names and other details of facilities at polling stations were read out by a visually challenged person through the Braille guide provided by the Election Commission.

Using an online facility, the officials, in the presence of the Collector, checked whether the names of the differently abled persons figured in the voter list. The officials also handed over the details of the polling station, including its location, the part and serial numbers of the voters in the voter list, so that they could positively turn up at the polling station. “Our aim is to ensure that 100 per cent of the differently-abled persons participate in the polling,” the Collector, said.

Sattur Revenue Divisional Officer Krishnammal, Returning Officer Dhanalingam, Sattur Tahsildar R.K. Pushparajan took part.
title: Arrangements in place at polling stations for differently abled voters: Collector
